alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Sitka; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 24 at 1:56PM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW LASTING THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure over the NE Gulf will remain in place through Friday night while an associated front with embedded waves will move over the panhandle. A stronger wave along the front will cause rates to pick up in the late afternoon and evening hours Friday. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals due to limited moisture in the central and northern inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates continue to be Friday evening through early Saturday morning while Yakutat may see snow ending earlier. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Sitka, Admiralty Island and Western Kupreanof Island and Kuiu Island including Angoon, Kake, and Port Alexander. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to reduced visibility and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry snow has been falling through day with an increase in snowfall rates expected. Greatest snowfall rates are expected late Friday afternoon through Friday night. Some mixing with rain is likely near Port Alexander Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Sitka; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
